msContents.summary: Business letter about a problem connected with some pitch and 2 ladders; the writer mentions that he spoke or wrote to Count Horigenes and to another person about the affair

msItem.note: Written along the fibers; the back is blank
11 lines of writing by a practiced hand with some flourishes; characteristic curlicue paragraphos at the end
The letter ends abruptly with "quickly" which indicates that the writer, who uses titulatures for the persons mentioned, is of similar rank as the adressee

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell, in July 1923; no. 58 (V.A.6) in Bell's inventory

div.ab: . . . about them, and ask the most magnificent Count Horigenes, too, on my behalf, about the 500 pounds of pitch and the two gangways; for I wrote to His Illustriousness too about this, but it is necessary for Your Erudition also to remind (him) and give me the answer about these things quickly.
